  3. Mattress recycling and collection scheme

Mattress recycling and collection scheme

Program:

Soft Landing

Location:

ACT
NSW
Vic
WA

The Soft Landing mattress recycling and collection scheme assists residents and businesses in the ACT, NSW, Victoria and Western Australia to recycle mattresses.

For a fee you can drop of your mattress at a recycling facility or pay an additional fee to have your mattress picked up.

Participants can:

  • recycle steel, foam, husk, timber and fabric
  • reduce waste going to landfill
  • create employment opportunities.

Eligibility

Not all state regions are covered by the scheme. Check to see if your area is covered at the Soft Landing website. 

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Soft Landing Mattress Recycling

Website: Soft Landing

Phone: 1800 763 852

  3. Medical cooling and heating electricity concession

Medical cooling and heating electricity concession

Program:

Medical Cooling and Heating Electricity Concession Scheme

Location:

Qld

The Medical Cooling and Heating Electricity Concession Scheme helps with electricity costs for people who have a chronic medical condition, such as:

  • multiple sclerosis
  • autonomic system dysfunction
  • significant burns
  • a severe inflammatory skin condition aggravated by changes in temperature.

The scheme currently provides $340.85 (including GST) per year to eligible applicants.

Eligibility

To be eligible under the scheme you must:

  • be a Queensland resident
  • live at your principal place of residence which has an air-conditioning or heating unit
  • have a qualifying medical condition and need cooling or heating to stop your  symptoms becoming significantly worse. Qualifying medical conditions include:
    • multiple sclerosis
    • autonomic system dysfunction
    • loss of skin integrity or sweating capacity
    • severe compromise of functioning such as mobility at extremes of environmental temperature
    • hypersensitivity to extremes of environmental temperature leading to increased pain or other discomfort or an increased risk of complications.

The applicant and/or legal guardian of a minor with a qualifying medical condition must:

  • hold a current Pensioner Concession Card or a current Health Care Card
  • be financially responsible for paying the electricity bill.

Eligibility is reviewed every 2 years. Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Queensland Government

Website: Medical Cooling and Heating Electricity Concession Scheme

Email: concessions@smartservice.qld.gov.au

Phone: 13 74 68

  3. Medical cooling concession

Medical cooling concession

Program:

Medical cooling concession

Location:

Vic

Eligible card holders could receive a concession on electricity costs related to medically-required cooling.

The concession is 17.5% of electricity usage and service costs between 1 November and 30 April.

During this period the Medical cooling concession is given in addition to the Annual electricity concession.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, the electricity account holder must have a medical condition that affects their body's ability to self-regulate temperature or have a household member with such a medical condition.

The account holder must also hold one of the following concession cards:

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Health Care Card
  • Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card.

Other conditions may apply.

Eligible medical conditions

Pre-approved conditions are:

  • multiple sclerosis
  • lymphoedema
  • parkinson’s disease
  • fibromyalgia
  • post-polio syndrome/poliomyelitis
  • motor neurone disease.

Applications for other conditions must be approved by the Victorian Department of Health and Human Services.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Medical cooling concession

Email: concessions@health.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 658 521

Medical cooling or heating concession

Program:

Medical cooling or heating concession

Location:

Tas

The medical cooling or heating concession provides a daily discount to eligible Tasmanian customers who have, or who live with a person who has, a medical condition that requires the cooling or heating of the customer's principal place of residence in order to manage that medical condition.

Eligibility

As well as meeting the medical requirements, you must also have one of the following to be eligible for the concession:

  • Services Australia Card
  • DVA Pensioner Concession Card
  • Services Australia Health Care Card.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Tasmanian Government

Website: Medical cooling or heating concession

Email: concessions@dpac.tas.gov.au

Phone: 1300 135 513

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Medical energy rebate

Medical energy rebate

Program:

Medical Energy Rebate

Location:

NSW

The Medical Energy Rebate helps eligible NSW households cover the costs of their energy bills. 

The rebate is for NSW customers who have an inability to self-regulate body temperature when exposed to extreme hot or cold environmental temperatures.

You'll receive the rebate as approximately $71 credit on each quarterly energy bill, up to a total of $285 per year. The amount is calculated daily from the day you apply.

The rebate is available to both retail and on supply customers.

Eligibility

You can apply for the Medical Energy Rebate if you or someone living at the address of the eligible customer:

  • is a NSW resident
  • is an account holder named on the bill of an energy retailer
  • has an inability to self-regulate body temperature
  • has been assessed by a registered medical practitioner (who is not the applicant) who has been treating them for at least 3 months
  • meets at least one Primary Qualifying Condition and at least one Secondary Qualifying Condition
  • holds one of the following concession cards:
    • Pensioner Concession Card issued by the Department of Veterans' Affairs (DVA) or Services Australia
    • Health Care Card issued by Services Australia
    • DVA Gold Card.

If you've been treated by different doctors from the Royal Flying Doctor Service (RFDS) for at least 3 months, you may still be eligible for the rebate.

Commonwealth Seniors Health Card holders are not eligible for this rebate.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Medical Energy Rebate

  3. Medical heating and cooling concession

Medical heating and cooling concession

Program:

Medical Heating and Cooling Concession

Location:

SA

The Medical Heating and Cooling Concession (MHCC) assists South Australians on a fixed or low income who have a clinically verified medical condition which requires the frequent use of heating or cooling in the home to prevent the severe worsening of their condition.

The concession amount is indexed each financial year and is available to eligible applicants in addition to the current energy concession.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the MHCC, applicants must:

  • live at the address on the application form
  • have, or be the parent or legal guardian of, a child who has a qualifying medical condition requiring cooling or heating to prevent severe worsening of their condition
  • provide certification from their medical specialist or general practitioner that the medical condition is severely worsened by hot or cold weather
  • use an air conditioning unit at that address to meet their medical heating and cooling requirements
  • be financially responsible for the full or part payment of the energy bill
  • hold an eligible concession card or receive an eligible Centrelink payment.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of South Australia

Website: Medical Heating and Cooling Concession

Email: MHC@sa.gov.au

Phone: 1300 735 350 (Medical Heating and Cooling line) or 1800 307 758 (ConcessionsSA Hotline)

  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. No-interest loans for energy efficiency investment

No-interest loans for energy efficiency investment

Program:

Energy Saver Loan Scheme

Location:

Tas

The Energy Saver Loan Scheme provides no-interest loans to eligible applicants to ease the up-front cost of making energy efficient investments in your home, business or organisation.

Loans under the scheme:

  • are interest-free
  • have no establishment fee
  • have no account-keeping fee (although fees for late repayments do apply).

Eligibility

Loans under the scheme must be used to purchase and install eligible energy efficient products in Tasmanian properties.

Eligible applicants for the scheme are:

  • Tasmanians for their principal place of residence
  • landlords with residential tenants in Tasmania
  • Tasmanian small businesses and community organisations (with an electricity consumption lower than 150MWh per year).

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Brighte

Website: Energy Saver Loan Scheme-

Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Non-mains electricity concession

Non-mains electricity concession

Program:

Non-mains electricity concession

Location:

Vic

Eligible concession card holders who source non-mains energy for their heating, cooking and hot water can apply for a concession to help cover their yearly energy costs.

The concession applies to these non-mains sources of energy:

  • liquefied petroleum gas (LPG)
  • firewood for domestic heating, cooking or hot water
  • heating oil
  • electricity accessed via an embedded network
  • generator fuel.

The concession is paid annually based on the amount paid for each energy type in that year.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, the electricity account holder must have one of the following:

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Health Care Card
  • Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Non-mains energy concession

Email: Nmec.rebates@health.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 658 521

Waterwise plants

All Western Australians are able to access the plant selector.

  3. Power Saving Bonus for all Victorian households

Power Saving Bonus for all Victorian households

Program:

Power Saving Bonus

Location:

Vic

The Power Saving Bonus (PSB) is a one-off $250 payment to Victorian households who look for a better energy deal on the Victorian Energy Compare website.

The new $250 payment builds on the existing PSB program, previously available to eligible concession card holders.

Please note: The department does not administer this program. For more information and to make further enquiries, visit the Victorian Energy Compare website or see contact details further below.

Eligibility 

To be eligible for the PSB you must be:

  • a Victorian residential energy consumer (i.e. have a residential electricity account)
  • the account holder.

Only one payment is available per household.

On 24 March 2023, a new round of the PSB program commenced. Victorian households are now able to receive a new $250 payment, including any households that received a payment through previous rounds of the program.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Victorian Energy Compare

Email: info.vec@delwp.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 000 832

Power system upgrade incentives

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy Savings Scheme can assist eligible NSW businesses with power system upgrade incentives.

You should contact an approved supplier well before you begin an upgrade project. The supplier will explain the process and assist with the incentive.

You may need to measure your power system’s energy use for some time before and after the upgrade. This can be done by sub-metering or checking your energy bills.    

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, your business must:

  • be located in NSW
  • use an approved supplier.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

  3. Process change and control system upgrade incentives

Process change and control system upgrade incentives

Program:

Energy Savings Scheme

Location:

NSW

The Energy Savings Scheme can assist eligible NSW businesses with process change and control system upgrade incentives.

A range of industry specific equipment may be replaced or modified to improve the energy efficiency of industrial processes that consume gas or electricity in, for example:

  • mining and mineral processing
  • separation processes
  • chemical processes.

You should contact an approved supplier well before you begin an upgrade project. The supplier will explain the process and assist with the incentive.

You may need to measure your upgrade project’s energy use for some time before and after the upgrade. This can be done by sub-metering or checking your energy bills.    

Eligibility

To be eligible for assistance, your business must:

  • must be located in NSW
  • use an approved supplier.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Process change and control system upgrades

Rebate swap for solar and energy efficiency upgrades

Program:

Rebate swap for solar and energy efficiency upgrades

Location:

NSW

NSW residents currently receiving an energy rebate may be eligible to swap the rebate for a free 3 kilowatt solar system or energy efficient upgrades.

There are 3 offers available:

  • for homeowners - rebate swap for solar
  • for households not suitable for solar - rebate swap for energy upgrades
  • for Land and Housing Corporation tenants - rebate swap for solar.

Eligibility

To be eligible for these offers, you must:

  • currently receive the Low Income Household Rebate
  • hold a valid Pensioner Concession Card or Department of Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card.

Other conditions apply. See the NSW Government website for details.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: Rebate swap for solar and energy efficiency upgrades

Recycling online calculator for organisations

Program:

The Recyculator

Location:

NSW

The Recyculator is an interactive tool that calculates the environmental benefits of large scale recycling initiatives across 21 material types in NSW.

It assists NSW industry, businesses and councils to estimate the full environmental benefits of recycling, help broaden resource recovery programs, and communicate these benefits in an understandable way. It measures the greenhouse benefits, energy savings, water savings and landfill space saved and displays these results.

Contact

Administered by: NSW Government

Website: The Recyculator

Email: info@epa.nsw.gov.au

Phone: 131 555

Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Renewable power incentives

Renewable power incentives

Program:

Small-scale Renewable Energy Scheme

Location:

ACT
NSW
NT
Qld
SA
Tas
Vic
WA

Households and small businesses across Australia that install a small scale renewable energy system (solar, wind or hydro) or eligible hot water system may be able to receive a benefit under the Small-scale Renewable Energy Scheme (SRES) to help with the purchase cost.

Installing an eligible system allows the creation of Small-scale Technology Certificates (STCs) with a value that can be redeemed by selling or assigning them. The number of STCs created is based on:

  • the amount of renewable electricity the system produces or the amount of electricity consumption it reduces
  • the climate region where it’s installed.

Eligibility

Small-scale renewable systems that may be eligible for certificates include:

  • solar photovoltaic (PV) panels
  • wind turbines
  • hydro systems
  • solar water heaters, and
  • air source heat pumps.

Owners have 2 options for receiving benefit for their STCs:

  1. Assigning them to an agent, usually the system installer, in exchange for a discount or delayed cash payment.
  2. Selling the certificates themselves.

There are 2 options for selling the certificates:

  1. Through the open STCs market with pricing subject to market forces.
  2. Through the STCs Clearing House with the price fixed at $40 per STC, excluding GST.

Contact

Administered by: Clean Energy Regulator

Website: Small-scale Renewable Energy Scheme

Email: enquiries@cleanenergyregulator.gov.au

Phone: (02) 6159 3100

  3. Residential park resident concession

Residential park resident concession

Program:

Residential park resident concessions

Location:

SA

South Australian residents who live in a residential or caravan park may be eligible to receive a single combined concession to help with their energy, water and sewerage bills.

The concession amount is indexed each financial year. The amount you can receive depends on your living arrangements and the utilities you pay for. For example:

  • residents who own their own dwelling and pay for water, sewerage and energy may receive up to $548.81 per annum (paid quarterly)
  • tenants who pay for water and energy may receive up to $360.51 per annum (paid quarterly).

Eligibility

To be eligible for a residential park resident concession you must:

  • occupy the property as your principal place of residence
  • hold an eligible concession card or receive an eligible Centrelink payment.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of South Australia

Website: Residential park resident concessions

Reusable coffee cup scheme

Program:

Green Caffeen

Location:

ACT
NSW
NT
Qld
SA
Tas
Vic
WA

Green Caffeen's reusable Coffee Cup Scheme reduces disposable coffee cup use. Using a swap-and-go system, customers can return their used cup to the same cafe or another participating cafe - placing the cup back in rotation. 

It's free for all cafes and customers to get involved. Some cafes will discount the price of a cup of coffee is you're using a reusable cup. 

If you own a cafe or know a cafe that should get on board, more information is available at the Green Caffeen website.

Rebates and assistance

energy-theme-green

  1. Home
  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Shower heads for households

Shower heads for households

Program:

Shower heads for households

Location:

Vic

Victorian households and businesses upgrading their conventional shower head to a water-saving one may be entitled to a discount.

Participants can:

  • swap an old shower head for a new water-efficient model
  • improve water efficiency in the home
  • reduce water and energy bills
  • reduce environmental impact.

Eligibility 

To be eligible to upgrade your water-saving shower heads and get a discount you must:

  • be a Victorian household or business
  • have up to 2 inefficient showerheads with a flow rate above 9 litres per minute or below 3 stars (in a residential premises)
  • have the upgrade delivered or facilitated by an accredited provider
  • install an approved product.

Other conditions may apply.

There can be many approved products with varying quality and suitability so it is important to do your own research before proceeding.

Search the Essential Services Commission’s VEU Registry of Accredited Persons and register of approved products.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Shower heads for households

Phone: 136 186

Single-use plastic ban assistance

Program:

Single-use plastics ban

Location:

ACT

Some single-use plastics are now banned in the ACT. The Plastic Reduction Act 2021 prohibits the supply of certain single-use plastic items with penalties for businesses that do. 

Single-use plastic straws are harmful to the environment and are regularly in the list of the most littered items. They pollute our waterways and don't break down in landfill.

Businesses and community groups can get promotional resources and translated information related to the ban.

Eligibility

To be eligible your business must be located in the ACT.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Single-use plastics ban

Email: singleuseplastics@act.gov.au

Phone: 1800 844 946

  3. Solar and heat pump hot water system rebate

Solar and heat pump hot water system rebate

Program:

Solar Hot Water

Location:

Vic

The Solar Hot Water rebates provides Victorian households with up to $1000 to assist with the purchase of a solar or heat pump hot water system.

Not-for-profit community housing providers are also eligible to apply for the rebate on behalf of their tenants.

Eligibility

To be eligible for this incentive, you must:

  • have a combined household income of less than $180,000 per annum before tax
  • be an owner-occupier of a home valued at under $3 million
  • be replacing an existing hot water system that is older than 3 years from the date of purchase
  • choose a product that is on the Clean Energy Regulator’s Register of solar water heaters

Households will only be eligible for one rebate under the Solar Homes package. You cannot have received a solar PV rebate or a battery rebate under the program.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Hot water rebate

Email: enquiries@solar.vic.gov.au 

Phone: 1300 376 393

  1. Home

  3. Solar battery rebate

Solar battery rebate

Program:

Solar Homes Program

Location:

Vic

Solar Victoria is supporting eligible Victorian households to install a solar battery by providing a point-of-sale discount up to a maximum of $2,950 for eligible customers. An additional 1,700 rebates are now available.

Eligibility

To be eligible for this rebate, you must meet all of the following criteria:

  • the property already has solar PV panels with a capacity equal to or greater than 5 kW or is arranging to have one installed in conjunction with the solar battery installation
  • pre-approval is obtained from your Distributed Network Service Provider (DNSP) to safely connect a battery to the grid
  • the energy storage solution is listed on Solar Victoria’s Approved Battery List and the property does not have an existing energy storage system
  • you are the owner-occupier of the property where the system is to be installed
  • the combined household taxable income of all owners is less than $180,000 a year (based on your Australian Tax Office Notice of Assessment)
  • it is an existing property, valued at under $3 million based on the current council rates notice
  • you have not already received a rebate as an owner-occupier under the Solar Homes Program
  • the property address has not previously taken part in the Solar Homes Program
  • the owner/s agrees to receive information from their Distribution Network Service Provider about taking part in battery trials to maximise the value households get from them.

Other conditions may apply. 

Review the list of eligible postcodes (PDF 45KB).

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Solar battery rebate

Email: enquiries@solar.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1300 376 393

energy-theme-green

  2. Rebates and assistance
  3. Solar PV panel rebate

Solar PV panel rebate

Program:

Solar Homes Program

Location:

Vic

The Solar Homes Program solar PV rebate assists eligible Victorian households and rental property owners to install solar panels. Not-for-profit community housing providers are also eligible to apply for the rebate on behalf of the tenants.

There is additional assistance offered including no-interest loans to complement the rebate, as well as solar panels for rental properties and solar battery rebates.

Solar panel rebates are available of up to $1,400 plus the option of an interest-free loan for existing homes and homes under construction.

Eligibility

To be eligible for this rebate, you must:

  • be the owner-occupier of the property 
  • the owners have a combined household taxable income of less than $180,000 per year 
  • it is an existing property, valued at under $3 million
  • not have an existing solar PV system.

Not-for-profit community housing providers must meet the Solar Homes criteria for community housing organisations. 

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Solar panel rebate

Email: enquiries@solar.vic.gov.au 

Phone: 1300 376 393

  3. Solar rebates for small business

Solar rebates for small business

Program:

Solar for Business Program

Location:

Vic

The Solar for Business Program supports Victorian small businesses by reducing the upfront cost of installing an approved small-scale solar PV system up to 30kW.    

Rebates cover up to 50% of the cost of a rooftop solar system with a maximum rebate of $3,500.

Net costs are inclusive of GST and any contribution from Small-scale Technology Certificates (STCs) . 

Eligibility

All entity types, including charities and not-for-profit organisations, are eligible for the Solar for Business rebates providing that they:

  • own or rent the premises where the business is located
  • employ at least 1 person, not including the business owner, and less than 20 people 
  • operate from premises that are non-residential
  • operate from premises that are individually metered  
  • have not previously received a Solar for Business rebate  
  • have a solar system installed by a Solar Victoria approved solar retailer
  • install a solar system with a PV capacity size up to 30kW and detailed on the Solar Victoria approved product list
  • install the solar system following the program opening for applications on 28 May 2021.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Solar for Business Program

Email: enquiries@team.solar.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1300 376 393

Support for SA businesses to reduce their emissions

Program:

Net Zero Essentials Program

Location:

SA

Small to medium South Australian businesses can access support to reduce their greenhouse gas emissions through the Net Zero Essentials Program.

The program will be delivered by Business SA over 6 months supported by a $150,000 grant from the Government of South Australia.

Participants will be able to access online training and face-to-face support to help them better understand their emissions and how to reduce them.

Registrations of interest are now being sought from both metropolitan and regional small and family businesses.

Eligibility

Your business must have less than 200 full-time staff to be eligible for the support.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Business SA

Website: Net Zero Essentials Program – Expression of Interest

Sustainable event advice and support

Program:

Sustainable Event Program

Location:

ACT

Under the Sustainable Event Program, businesses can get free advice to make an event sustainable and climate friendly. Access free equipment such as signage, water units and bin tops.

For your event, the program will help you:

  • reduce waste and increase recycling
  • reduce energy and water use
  • reduce greenhouse gas emissions
  • educate and raise awareness of sustainability issues with your event visitors.

Eligibility

Public events of any size held in the ACT can be part of the program. This includes school fetes, community fairs, major music festivals, sporting events and more.

To be eligible for the program you must register your event by completing the Memorandum of Understanding.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Sustainable Event Program

Email: SustainableEventProgram@act.gov.au

Phone: 13 22 81

  3. Sustainable home upgrade rebate

Sustainable home upgrade rebate

Program:

Home Energy Support

Location:

ACT

Eligible concession card holders may be able to get rebates to help with the upfront costs of installing energy-efficient products and undertaking sustainable home upgrades.

Eligible homeowners can access a rebate of up to $2,500 for the installation of rooftop solar, and an additional rebate of up to $2,500 to install:

  • reverse cycle heating and cooling
  • hot water heat pumps
  • electric stove tops.

Other energy efficiency products may be added in future.

The program has an option to pay for the rest of your chosen products with an interest-free loan.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the rebate, you must:

  • be a resident of the ACT who holds an Australian Government Pensioner Concession Card or a Department of Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card
  • have attended a free Home Energy Support workshop
  • have an eligible property, which includes one you own and occupy where the product will be installed.

The workshop will provide information on the program, how to apply, and will help you with your energy efficient choices.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Home Energy Support: Rebates for Homeowners

Email: homeenergysupport@act.gov.au

Phone: 1300 141 777

Sustainable technology installation rebates

Program:

Sustainability Incentives Scheme

Location:

SA

The Sustainability Incentives Scheme offers rebates to residents, businesses, and groups located within the City of Adelaide municipal area for the installation of sustainable technologies in their home or building.

These can include:

  • residential, business and commercial solar PV
  • energy monitoring
  • appliance electrification
  • electric vehicle charging stations
  • water saving devices
  • home energy assessments.

Eligibility

Terms and conditions for residential, business and commercial, and non-profit community rebates are available on the City of Adelaide website.

Contact

Administered by: City of Adelaide

Website: Sustainability Incentives Scheme

Email: incentives@cityofadelaide.com.au

Phone: (08) 8203 7203

  3. Thermoregulatory dysfunction energy subsidy

Thermoregulatory dysfunction energy subsidy

Program:

Thermoregulatory Dysfunction Energy Subsidy Scheme

Location:

WA

The Thermoregulatory Dysfunction Energy Subsidy Scheme assists financially disadvantaged persons with thermoregulatory dysfunction, or their dependants, to offset the energy costs associated with controlling the temperature in their home under specialist medical advice.

Thermoregulatory dysfunction is defined as significant loss of a person’s capacity to control body temperature, and the medical conditions which result in the person’s health and bodily function being seriously affected when exposed to extremes of environmental temperatures.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the subsidy you must hold one of the following means-tested concession cards:

  • Pensioner Concession Card (issued by either Centrelink or the Department of Veterans’ Affairs)
  • Health Care Card (not including the Commonwealth Seniors Health Card)
  • Health Care Interim Voucher.

You may be either:

  • the patient who requires heating and/or cooling for their own use 
  • the guardian or primary caregiver if the patient is residing in their home.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Website: Thermoregulatory Dysfunction Energy Subsidy Scheme

Phone: (08) 9262 1373 or 1300 368 364 (WA country landline calls)

  3. Two years free registration for zero emissions vehicles

Two years free registration for zero emissions vehicles

Program:

Zero emissions vehicle registration

Location:

ACT

The ACT Government is offering 2 years of free registration for new or used zero emissions vehicles in the ACT that have been purchased or acquired from 24 May 2021 and before 30 June 2024.

If you are eligible, the waiver will only apply to the registration component of vehicle registration fees. All other relevant fees, charges, or levies related to registering a vehicle will remain, such as the annual cost of Motor Accident Injuries Insurance.

Eligibility

Eligible vehicles include:

  • new or used passenger and goods carrying vehicles under 4.5t that have an electric motor powered by electricity alone or cars powered by a hydrogen fuel cell
  • vehicles that have been converted from a different power source into one of the above vehicle configurations and certified as registrable on or after 24 May 2021 and before 30 June 2024
  • second hand zero emissions vehicles imported into Australia that meet the above requirements.

The following vehicles are not eligible:

  • zero emissions vehicles purchased before 24 May 2021 (however they will receive a 20% ongoing reduction in registration fees)
  • zero emissions heavy vehicles (e.g. trucks) and motorcycles (with 2 and 3 wheels).

Applicants for the waiver must:

  • finalise the vehicle transaction or acquire the vehicle on or after 24 May 2021 and before 30 June 2024.
  • not register the vehicle in their name prior to 24 May 2021
  • garage the vehicle in the ACT
  • hold an ACT Drivers License
  • have a physical premise in the ACT if the applicant is a business or company.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Zero emissions vehicle registration

Phone: 13 22 81

  3. Underground electricity connection charge rebate

Underground electricity connection charge rebate

Program:

Underground Electricity Connection Charge Rebate

Location:

WA

A concession is available for pensioners or seniors in WA as either a rebate on, or the deferment of, the Underground Electricity Connection Charge.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the rebate you must:

  • on 1 July of the current financial year, own and occupy the property as your ordinary place of residence
  • have one or more of the following cards:
    • Pensioner Concession Card or State Concession Card (up to 50% rebate, may be entitled to deferment)
    • WA Seniors Card and a Commonwealth Seniors Health Card (up to 50% rebate, may be entitled to deferment)
    • WA Seniors Card (up to 25% capped rebate, no deferment available)

Partial concessions are available to pensioners and seniors who own and occupy their property at 1 July and become eligible during that financial year.

Contact

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Website: Underground Electricity Connection Charge Rebate

Phone: 1300 368 364

Water efficiency rebates and offers

Waterwise

WA

Water Corporation have tailored rebates and offers available in Perth Metro and regional towns across WA to help householders save water in the home and garden.

Offers include:

  • rainwater tank rebates
  • free irrigation and plumbing services.

Eligibility

Rebates and offers are only available in certain locations. Check the Water Corporation website to see what programs are offered in your town or area and if you are eligible.

Water use checking assistance

Program:

Water Use Health Check

Location:

NT

The Living Water Smart free Water Use Health Check helps Katherine businesses, organisations and government reduce water use and water bills by:

  • analysing your water use in real time
  • providing a breakdown of your water use by key areas in your organisation including irrigation, leaks and general use
  • quantifying weekly costs for each water use area
  • providing advice on implementing easy actions to help you save, and advising if you’re eligible for any Living Water Smart rebates.

Eligibility

Any business, government or not-for-profit organisation in the Darwin region may be eligible for this program.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Power and Water

Website: Living Water Smart

Email: info@livingwatersmart.com.au

Phone: (08) 8995 5861

Winter gas concession

Program:

Winter gas concession

Location:

Vic

Eligible concession card holders could receive a concession on their gas bill during the winter months.

The concession is 17.5% of domestic mains gas usage and service costs between 1 May and 30 October each year, and is calculated after retailer discounts are deducted.

The concession does not apply to the first $62.40 of the 6-month winter period bills. This is calculated as a daily rate on each bill.

Eligibility

To be eligible for the concession, the electricity account holder must have one of the following:

  • Pensioner Concession Card
  • Health Care Card
  • Veterans’ Affairs Gold Card

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Victorian Government

Website: Winter gas concession

Email: concessions@health.vic.gov.au

Phone: 1800 658 521

Wood heater replacement incentive

Program:

Wood Heater Replacement Program

Location:

ACT

The Wood Heater Replacement Program provides an incentive for ACT residents to replace wood heaters or open fireplaces with an energy-efficient reverse cycle air-conditioner.

The following rebates are available:

  • Rebate 1: $250 for wood heater removal or decommission
  • Rebate 2: $1250 for wood heater removal and installation of ducted electric reverse cycle system
  • Rebate 3: $750 for wood heater removal and installation of electric reverse cycle split system (minimum 3 star energy rating) 
  • Rebate 4: $750 for wood heater removal and upgrade of electric reverse cycle system (minimum 3 star energy rating)

Eligibility

To be eligible for this rebate you must:

  • be an ACT ratepayer and the property must be zoned as 'residential'
  • be replacing a wood heater or an open fireplace with a new 3 star or higher rated reverse cycle air-conditioner.

Only one rebate is available per property. Owners of rental properties may also apply.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: ACT Government

Website: Wood Heater Replacement Program

Phone: 13 22 81

  3. Workplace EV charging grants

Workplace EV charging grants

Program:

Charge Up Workplace EV Charging Grants

Location:

WA

The Government of Western Australia is providing $15 million of grants for businesses to co-fund the cost of electric vehicle (EV) recharging infrastructure.

The EV chargers can be installed in the car park at your workplace or depot to be used by employees, fleet vehicles and visitors to ‘charge up at work’. Eligible businesses can also install them for use by customers to ‘charge up at play’, for example, at a tourist destination, café, recreation centre or winery.

Round one has an allocation of $3.75 million and will be open from 16 February 2023 until cob 12 May 2023.

Eligibility

The following applicants may be eligible for the grants.

  • applicants who will use the EV charger to charge during daytime hours (9am to 5pm) or overnight (9pm to 9am)—in general, charging that occurs mainly during the evening peak of 5pm-9pm will not be supported by the grant
  • applicants who will install the EV charger at a location within Western Australia
  • applicants who are one of the following types of organisations:
    • not-for-profits registered with the Australian Charities and not-for-profits commission (ACNC)
    • local government authorities established under the Local Government Act 1995
    • small to medium enterprises as defined by the Australian Bureau of Statistics, being either a small business employing less than 20 people, or a medium business employing between 20 and 199 people.

Some exclusions to these organisation types apply.

Other conditions may apply.

Contact

Administered by: Government of Western Australia

Website: Charge Up Workplace EV Charging Grants

Email: chargeup@dmirs.wa.gov.au

  3. Zero emission vehicle rebates

Zero emission vehicle rebates

Program:

Zero Emission Vehicle Rebate Scheme

Location:

Qld

Under the Zero Emission Vehicle Rebate Scheme, $3,000 rebates are available to eligible Queensland individuals and businesses who have purchased a new zero emission vehicle (ZEV) with a dutiable value of up to $58,000 (including GST) on or after 16 March 2022.

As at the introduction of the scheme, a ZEV refers to a full battery electric vehicle (BEV) only.

The scheme is limited to:

  • 1 rebate per individual
  • up to 5 rebates per Queensland business per financial year.

Eligibility

The scheme is open to:

  • Queensland residents with a current and valid Queensland driver license (international and interstate driver licences will not be accepted) or another form of evidence to prove residency
  • Queensland registered businesses
  • the purchase of light passenger and light commercial ZEV models only.

Other conditions apply.

For full eligibility criteria under the scheme, see the Queensland Rural and Industry Development Authority website.

Contact

Administered by: Queensland Rural and Industry Development Authority

Website: Queensland Zero Emission Vehicle Rebate Scheme
